subproject.corporate outcome: Electoral laws, processes and institutions strengthen inclusive participation and professional electoral administration
subproject.description: The introduction of translucent ballot boxes (TBBs) can help to build public confidence in the credibility of elections. Through this project, the Bangladesh Election Commission (BEC) will introduce TBBs for the 2008 parliamentary elections by procuring the boxes, training the users and informing the public about their role and use in the election. The polling procedures will also be revised to reflect the steps required to maximize the effectiveness of the TBBs.
subproject.title: Translucent Ballot Boxes

subproject.corporate outcome: Electoral laws, processes and institutions strengthen inclusive participation and professional electoral administration
subproject.title: Construction of Server Station

subproject.corporate outcome: Electoral laws, processes and institutions strengthen inclusive participation and professional electoral administration
subproject.title: Construction of Server Station

subproject.description:
UNDP has been providing technical and development assistance to the Bangladesh Election Commission since 1996 and is working closely in the key reform areas. For the preceding years UNDP’s support to BEC has been largely constituted through the projects ‘Support to Electoral Process’ and ‘Preparation of Electoral Roll with Photographs’ (PERP) projects. The SEP project has been a continuation of UNDP longer term support and has built the foundation for other areas of assistance including providing the ICT base for PERP- the flagship project that registered more than 81 million people in a span of just 11 months. In addition, in order to sustain the electoral reform undertaken, UNDP is also administrating the project ‘Construction of Server Stations for Electoral Database (CSSED)’ to build server stations nationwide. UNDP has also continued to provide policy advisory support to the BEC, providing assistance to complete the photo voter list act, delimitation act, the candidates and results declaration rules, and supporting the BEC to complete an organisational review to provide recommendation. 
With the completion of SEP project in June 2010 and the PERP project in December 2010, the preparatory assistance (PA) is designed to enable the development of  UNDP’s next phase of electoral reform programming. Through the PA project, UNDP will formulate a new project, continue to provide technical assistance to the BEC during the interim period as well as support initiatives that raise awareness and continue the momentum for electoral reform in Bangladesh.
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: PA for Electoral Reform

subproject.corporate outcome: Electoral laws, processes and institutions strengthen inclusive participation and professional electoral administration

subproject.title: PA for Electoral Reform

subproject.corporate outcome: Electoral laws, processes and institutions strengthen inclusive participation and professional electoral administration
subproject.description:
This 5-year electoral support project consists of technical assistance designed to enhance and further
consolidate the institutional and professional capacities of the BEC, its Secretariat and local offices to
deliver its mandated functions of conducting fair, credible and transparent elections and further
consolidating itself as a permanent, professional, credible and independent institution of governance
subproject.gender code: Gender Equality as a principal objective
subproject.title: Strengthening Election Mgt.

title: Support to the Electoral Process in Bangladesh
